results.name: Array read by antidiagonals. Rows contain odd numbers reaching same odd successor in Collatz function iteration.
comment: All numbers that end in 3 will begin with numbers from previous row (for example, 3413 is 341&3). - _Jean-Bernard François_, Sep 09 2013
The sequence is a permutation of the odd positive integers. - _Bob Selcoe_, Jul 26 2015
example: Construct array by writing odd numbers in columns, taking first overflow after two steps and then an overflow each fourth step (for each column).
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := 2^(2*(k + 1) - 1)*(n + Quotient[n + 1, 3]) + (4^(k + 1) - 1)/3; Table[t[n - k, k], {n, 0, 8}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 09 2013, after _Maon Wenders_ *)
xref: First row = A002450 (except leading zero), second row = A072197, third row = A072261.
